VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
independent audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator documented there were no special investigations (during
this reporting period) nor licensing violations during the interim licensing inspection
last year. She also documents there have been no barriers or systemic factors that
impacted the facility’s ability to comply with licensing rules this reporting period. It
is documented the facility has added a full-time therapist and lead specialist. It is
documented the facility has added a Residential Services Coordinator to support
the direct care staff and supervision of the therapists will be conducted by the
Clinical Services Supervisor. It is documented these changes are not in response
to any corrective action plan but rather an effort to build the structure of the
program to support staff and youth in the program. The Chief Administrator
documents the training of “Trust Based Relational Intervention” for all staff with
plans to have this completed in October 2025. Two staff have been selected to
become trainers so the facility can provide this training when needed and this
training model is to help staff manage their reactions to the youth’s trauma
reactions. The next step in this structure building is the implementation of the
Power Source which is described as the “youth version of Emotional Intelligence
(EQ2)”. The focus of staff trainings has been on staff recognizing trauma

responses from youth which is based on the “EQ2” model which allows staff to
manage their stress responses to the youth’s trauma reactions. The action steps
for this training schedule are as follows:
• All staff will participate in an EQ2 Group within the first 60 days of employment.
• All staff will be trained in the basics of Trust Based Relational Interventions
(TBRI) within 60 days of employment.
• All staff will have access to the EQ2 app.
• All staff will use the recognition feature on the EQ2 app to recognize peers for the
use of TBRI and EQ2 skills.
The Chief Administrator documents another factor at the facility is the decrease in
staff turnover. The Chief Administrator reports there have been 11 planned
discharges (11 total discharges) during this reporting period. She notes the
average length of stay for youth has been 94 days with an increase of discharges
into the community setting this past year. The Chief Administrator documents
engaging the staff in wellness activities during the upcoming year. The facility has
also hired a Human Resources Business Partner position to assist the Operations
Director with human resources and hiring requirements.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed shared a report of a high investment in the youth doing well and
appeared to use the best practices approach when dealing with the youth. Staff
also reported receiving significant training (EQ2 and TBRI) to help deal with
trauma issues the youth might present. Administration is also invested in the youth
doing well and report a strong effort to meet the different needs of the youth and
provide the staff with the best possible training and support.
All three of the youth in the program currently were interviewed. They reported
feeling safe at the facility and believed the program is beneficial to meet their
needs. All report receiving therapy session both individually and in a group setting.
They also reported a belief that the staff are invested in their wellbeing and are
attentive to their needs.
Description of Agency Walk Through
This is a single-story facility in excellent condition and very well maintained in all
aspects. There is a fully stocked kitchen, and all plumbing is in working order. The
cleaning supplies are locked away from the youth. The medications are behind 2
locked doors and locked in cabinets in the medication room. Items requiring
posting were found posted appropriately. Fire extinguishers were up to date and
fire drills logs were also appropriate. Room check logs are documented as being
completed appropriately.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
